stories.headline: CAR in the aftermath
stories.summary: An in-depth investigation by The Miami Herald using computer-assisted reporting techniques to analyze the contentious and narrow presidential election results in Florida. The team investigated issues like voter fraud and ballot counting accuracy, revealing organized efforts and discrepancies.

stories.headline: Everyday methods
stories.summary: Joe Ellis reflects on adapting computer-assisted reporting methods into his everyday reporting practices after attending a NICAR bootcamp. His work highlights how these methods enhance the depth of investigative journalism in local news stories.

stories.headline: Four-day success
stories.summary: A quick, four-day investigation revealing disparities in discarded presidential votes across Florida counties, showing higher discard rates in poorer areas. The report sparked discussions on voting machine reliability and voter education.

stories.headline: Florida's dead heat
stories.summary: Reflecting on his involvement with The Miami Herald's investigation into the Florida presidential election, Doig explains the statistical methods used to project voting intentions based on uncounted ballots, revealing potential impacts on election outcomes.

stories.headline: Hospital Infections
stories.summary: An investigation into hospital-acquired infections using publicly available billing data, uncovering potential underreported cases of flesh-eating bacteria, resulting in state health officials launching an investigation.

stories.headline: Ammonia leaks
stories.summary: An investigation into the rise of ammonia leaks related to methamphetamine production, highlighting the hazards posed to communities and the challenges faced by emergency responders and law enforcement officials.

stories.headline: 10 Census stories
stories.summary: A guide for journalists covering the 2000 Census, presenting ten story ideas that leverage census data to uncover trends and stories in local communities, focusing on diversity, density, and more.

stories.headline: Census and immigrants
stories.summary: An overview of how journalists can use Census data and other federal datasets to report on immigration trends and the demographics of foreign-born populations within their communities.
